title: A media source video cannot be started at a specific time when it transitions, with VLC video source it's possible

labels.name: Confirmed
labels.description: This bug report has been confirmed by project members

body:
<!-- READ THIS FIRST -->
<!-- The OBS Studio GitHub issue tracker is **ONLY** to be -->
<!-- used for reporting Bugs that have replication steps. -->

<!-- You can post Feature Requests here: https://ideas.obsproject.com/ -->
<!-- Get help for Support Issues here: https://obsproject.com/help -->

<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->

## Platform
<!-- Please fill out the following information about your bug report. -->
<!-- If you are on Linux and installed using a package, please list the package type. -->
Operating system and version: Windows 10 Pro 1903
OBS Studio version: 25.0.8 and last nightly

## Expected Behavior
<!--- Tell us what should happen -->
Media Source should work like VLC Video Source when transitioning a video that has already started (paused at some point).
The video should start from the point where it was paused.

## Current Behavior
<!--- Tell us what happens instead of the expected behavior. -->
<!--- Please include a log file here if possible. -->
Media Source doesn't start from the point where it was paused when transitioning, it will start from the beginning.
In the last nightly with source context bar, does not start from the beginning but it will fast forward trying to get to that point.

## Steps to Reproduce
<!--- Provide a link to a live example, or an unambiguous set of steps to -->
<!--- reproduce this bug. Include code to reproduce, if relevant. -->
<!--- Screenshots and video are encouraged if applicable. -->
With OBS Studio 25.0.8, Media Controls plugin is needed to use the seek bar.

1. In Studio Mode (preview), leave a Media Source video paused somewhere in the middle
2. Transition the scene in preview to program
3. The video will not start from the point where it was paused, it will start from the beginning
4. In the nightly, it will fast forward trying to get to that point

## Additional information
<!--- Not obligatory, but provide any additional details or information -->
<!--- that you feel might be relevant to the issue -->
Video with 25.0.8 - VLC & Media Source
https://i.gyazo.com/8d04f0b5694ca9abefdab3a844f23599.gif

Nightly with the context bar - VLC & Media Source
https://i.gyazo.com/ed83bd8b0a141470484bc765c29b499a.gif
You can also see the high CPU consumption of issue https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/issues/3235.

It is very useful to be able to show a video from a specific point, not always only from the beginning.
